data.title: Picker is slow when used with many thousand elements

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 7, Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Call showQuickPick() with the items from [here](https://gist.github.com/Wosi/34713260519924210d2007e26cdeab00)
2. Type "test" letter by letter. You'll see the slow responding quick picker. The code completion box responds much faster working on the same data.

data.title: Allow to copy/paste file between windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:23:30.856Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

I just tried copy/pasting and dragging a file between two vscode trees and found it would not copy. On the other hand, revealing that file in the Finder and then dragging it into the other window allowed me to achieve the copy. 

It would be nice if was possible to do all of this without needing to go through the Finder.

data.title: Issues with terminal flowControl
data.body:
Terminal flowControl, driven by the `terminal.integrated.flowControl` setting which defaults to true if `$SHELL`'s basename is `bash`. The poses some problems though:

- If another shell is run within it, it may not support flow control meaning it will show broken output
- Using the pty's process name could be an option but this changes even when the shell runs something like `gulp` or `node`, so it would lose the benefits in most cases.

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19474
Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19766

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Welcome editor icon
data.body:
Currently using the product icon. From @joaomoreno:

I'm more in favour of using a meaningful icon for each of the features instead of the product icon. From https://vsicons.azurewebsites.net/, the VSTS Bowtie Icon Font collection, I suggest the following icons:

- For the Welcome, search for `alert`. The second icon, which is a flag, would do the trick. Alternatively, maybe `devices` or `globe`?
- For the interactive playground, search for `run`. Any of those play button icons should work perfectly. Alternatively the `log` icon is pretty good too.

data.title: [Feature Request] Format option to not insert space between non-empty curly braces in TS/JS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Would it be possible to add a formatting option to not automatically insert a space between non-empty curly braces in JS and TS?

**Example:**
```javascript
var prop = 1;
var obj = {prop};
```
Will get formatted as:
```javascript
var prop = 1;
var obj = { prop };  
```

It does appear that the space will not be inserted for empty braces (`var obj = {};`). That's what I expect, but that should probably be an option too.

Thanks!

data.title: Implement HLSL syntax highlighting, and use HLSL grammar to highlight Cg blocks in ShaderLab files
data.body: Implements #20128. In contrast to the existing ShaderLab grammar, this new ShaderLab grammar delegates highlighting of Cg blocks to the separate HLSL grammar (which has the advantage that standalone HLSL files can now be highlighted). I created both the HLSL and ShaderLab grammars by reading the relevant language documentation, so they should both be up-to-date with available types / keywords / etc. I also looked at the latest `csharp.tmLanguage` so that my choice of scope names roughly matches what has been done there. Because `.cginc` files are basically HLSL files, and not ShaderLab files, I've removed that file extension from the ShaderLab extension and included it in the HLSL extension. For comparison, here's what ShaderLab syntax highlighting looks like in VSCode 1.9: And here's what it looks like using this new ShaderLab grammar: This is what standalone HLSL syntax highlighting looks like using the new HLSL grammar: This is my first contribution to VSCode - I'm very happy to make changes, just let me know what I got wrong :)

data.title: Implement HLSL syntax highlighting
data.body:
VSCode already includes built-in syntax highlighting for Unity ShaderLab files. It would be nice to also include built-in syntax highlighting for HLSL files. (And HLSL was created by Microsoft, to give weight to the included-by-default argument.)

ShaderLab files include embedded Cg shaders (between `CGPROGRAM`/`ENDCG` or `CGINCLUDE`/`ENDCG` delimiters).

As stated [here](https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/SL-ShadingLanguage.html), as far as Unity is concerned, HLSL and Cg can be treated as the same thing:

> In Unity, shader programs are written in a variant of HLSL language (also called Cg but for most practical uses the two are the same).

So if we:
* add HLSL syntax highlighting to VSCode
* use HLSL syntax highlighting within `CGPROGRAM`/`ENDCG` as an embedded grammar

... we can both improve ShaderLab syntax highlighting, and also support HLSL syntax highlighting.

I'm just about to submit a PR with these proposed changes.

data.title: Debug: [nodejs] some logs by logging libs are not shown in console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OSX Sierra

When I upgraded to 1.9.0, some logs stopped appearing on the debug console. I've noticed it seems to only happen with logs sent by logging libs (ex: morgan, winston). `console.log` and node errors are still shown.

Debugging as general seems ok.

**Context** nodejs debugging
 - my nodejs version: 7.2.1
 - launch.json has `node2` mode.

**Workarounds**
 - changing debug type to "node" instead of "node2" fixes it
 - sending the output to the integrated terminal, instead of the debug console (`console : "integratedTerminal"`) fixes it

data.title: Rapidly updating TextDocumentContentProvider causes the previewHtml window to break
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Creating a TextDocumentContentProvider and having it emit an onDidChange event on every vscode.workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument event causes the following exceptions in the preview webview after a few keystrokes:
webview.ts:94[Embedded Page] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollTop' of null
webview.ts:94[Embedded Page] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'setAttribute' of null

The preview window will stop displaying updated content until it is closed and reopened.

data.title: Incorrect "window.menuBarVisibility" behaviour between restarts
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|alignment|annsk|0.3.0|
|latex|ms-vscode|0.1.3|

---

Expected behavior: menu bar remains hidden
Actual behavior: menu bar becomes visisble after restart

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set ` window.menuBarVisibility` to `hidden`
2. Close VS Code and open it again

The menu bar is now permanently visible, as if set to `default`. Setting the option to `toggle` and then back to `hidden` hides the menu bar, but this solution does not persist to the next session.

data.title: Debug does not work on big projects (mixing js and typescript)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Mac OS-X Sierra

The debug interface is unresponsive on a big project. With unresponsive I mean that it does not do anything at all: it does not throw any error, it is not able to generate any launch file, it does not start the debugging, it is unable to connect to an existing node debugger...

I'm afraid that this is related to the fact that I'm mixing some js modules with typescript modules. I'm using a monorepo structure, and I open the entire monorepo folder with vscode.

- Root
  - .vscode
  - package.json (global)
  - src
    - jsmodule
      - package.json
    - jsmodule
      - package.json
    - tsmodule
      - .vscode
      - package.json
      - tsconfig.json


Before adding the typescript module everything was working fine, that's why I think that this is related to the fact that I have a typescript module inside the folder structure. 


If there is any way of extracting any extra log information or traces I would love to provide them.

Regards


**EDIT**

I think I found the problem. Two things seems to be involved:
- The existence of a `.vscode` folder under the typescript module subfolder
- My old launch.json seems to be wrong

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to open the application - Application icon appears briefly in the dock and then exits. There is nothing in any log that I can find (dmesg, system log in console.app, crash logs), no errors, nothing at all to go on. The only thing that I can think of that might have broken things is the macOS window server crashing and having to log in again probably leaving something in an inconsistent state, but I have no idea where to start looking.

Good thing I don't need a text editor for my job as a software engineer.

data.title: Not possible to add options to string properties
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

I'm
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file like this but with only 2 PathTypes (without PATHTYPE_WORKSPACE):
export const PATHTYPE_WORKSPACE = "W";  // This line comes later
export const PATHTYPE_FOLDER = "F";   
export const PATHTYPE_PROCESS = "P"; 
export type PathType = "F" | "W" | "P";

export interface PathDetails {
  workspaceId: string,
  pathId: string,
  parentPathId?: string,
  pathType: PathType 
}

2. Add the additional option "PATHTYPE_WORKSPACE"

3. Now PATHTYPE_WORKSPACE cannot be assigned to pathType, only "F" and "P" are allowed:
error TS2365: Operator '==' cannot be applied to types '"F" | "P"' and '"W"'.

-> Somehow VS Code and/or TypeScript are caching the old property settings?
Reload, restart etc. don't help.

Is there an option to refresh properties?

data.title: Support debug console output from extensions
data.body:
Since debug extensions start to have more code running in the extension, we need a way that this code can send information messages to the same channel ('debug console') as debug adapters.

One example: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/issues/126

data.title: Code snippet control indentation
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

How can I  control unindentation in code snippets?

```json
{
    "Create migration helper execute statement": {
        "prefix": "mhe",
        "body": [
            "\\$helper->execute(<<<SQL",
            "\t$0",
            "\rSQL",
            ");"
        ]
    }
}
```

When invoking it in indented context:

```php
class Migration {
→   public function up(Helper $helper) {
→   →   mhe<tab complete snippet>
→   }
}
```

Expected behavior:

```php
class Migration {
→   public function up(Helper $helper) {
→   →   $helper->execute(<<<SQL
→   →   →   |<cursor>
SQL
→   →   );
→   }
}
```

Actual behavior:

```php
class Migration {
→   public function up(Helper $helper) {
→   →   $helper->execute(<<<SQL
→   →   →   |<cursor>
→   →   
→   →   SQL
→   →   );
→   }
}
```

This is invalid behavior when using heredoc.

I tried to insert `\r` <carriage return> to try removing all indentation,
but it is just translated to a newline and indented according to snippet context.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

data.title: Gulp tasks not detected automatically since upgrading to 1.9
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder with a gulpfile.js
2. Type `task default` in the command panel 
3. No tasks detected

Since upgrading to last version (1.9), VS Code doesn't detect Gulp tasks automatically from the gulpfile.js. I tested this on 2 computers and on different projects that were working fine on 1.8 and before.

I found a workaround : use the `Configure Task Runner` command, let it create a tasks.json and then use the `task` command.
Is it now the desired behavior? I didn't see any mentions about this in the changelog.

Thanks.
